name: Oakwood Manor Bed and Breakfast

reviews.title: Out of 11 places we stayed on a trip this was the best room.
reviews.text: This is a quiet B&B off the beaten track. It is reasonably priced. We stayed in the new suite and thought it a terrific well furnished room . Owners are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ordinary but plentiful and wel prepared.

There isn't much in Cape North as far as accomodations so I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this B&B. I was very pleased to find a very inviting farm home with lovely oak wood and a friendly and helpful host.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a bit small but the bathroom was very large with a jacuzzi tub and window overlooking the lovely lawns. There is a sitting room on the main floor with a TV and a computer. The computer although nice to have is VERY slow and outdated. My suggestion to the host is to update to a new one with an up to date operating system and high speed internet.
reviews.title: nice place to stay
Tranquil B&B on the Cabot Trail
reviews.text: Breakfast was simple but tasty. The table is a nice long wooden one guests can sit around at and chat. The modern touches along with the older items such a wood stove on display was a delight to see and reminise about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this B&B for comfort, cleanliness and interest.
reviews.title: Our stay at Oakwood Manor

likes.disliked: — Hard to find the place on a map

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a nice, quiet, secluded place to stay - the oakwood manor is a great choice. nice, clean, spacious rooms, large bathrooms with jaccuzi and very friendly and helpful staff. would definetely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great B&B, with wonderful host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Oakwood Manor for one night only and after a long day exploring the western side of the Cabot Trail and a hike - this beautifully located farmhouse was a welcome sight. The location is slightly off the Cabot Trail, but very well marked with small and larger signs along the side roads. Cape North does not have much in the way of amenities (local convenience type store, one restaurant) but what it does have is raw beauty - nature abounds. This B & B fits right in, on acres of a well maintained yard, walks through the marshes and endless trees and mountains abutting the property.
reviews.title: One Beautiful Stay

reviews.text: The house itself is beautiful, the interior glimmering in polished wood. A large dining room for your use with teas and cookies, a computer for your use and another living room with a large televison and sofas/chairs. There is also a screened in porch - which made for a great spot to spend the evening with picnic food we had left (since as I said if you get in this area later in the evening - there is not much for eating possibilities). At dusk this was perfect, for the weather was pleasant and we could enjoy the fresh air till dark.
reviews.title: Not the experience we were told to expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room looked out to the mountain and marshes in the rear of the property, nice to have wide open windows. The room itself was immaculate, very good sized, with a queen bed and a bureau. The bath was very large with a wall size sink counter and a oversized tub/shower. Towels were lined dried - which was a bit scratchy, but very clean smelling and fresh - so that was neat. No TV's in rooms - but offered downstairs in the living room for guests. Entire property was welcoming and comfortable. Very quiet.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was in the kitchen shared amongest guests at a large wooden table with bench seating. Breakfast was made fresh as you came (available from 7:30-9:30) very simple but good (eggs, bacon, toast, juice, coffee). Hosts were very nice, accomodating , but not intrusive at all.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay at Cape North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the cost (less than $89.00 UDS a night) - this was an exceptional stay. Very close to drive down to St Margaret's Bay or onto Meat Cove. Surrounded by peaceful nature, beautiful home, clean, comfortable room and decent breakfast to start the day - can't get much better than that.
reviews.title: Oakwood Manor is MARVELOUS!

likes.liked: — The perfect and beautiful condition of the inn.
likes.disliked: — There are very few good restaurants nearby and we chose one with poor service.

aka: Oakwood Manor Bed And Breakfast Cape North, Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia
